learning_outcomes.description: Develop, design, and complete an educational research project, demonstrating knowledge and understanding of sources of professional learning and the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers in identifying professional learning needs (APST 6.1 & 6.2).
Successfully formulate and investigate a research question and/or set of research questions.
Conduct a critical, thorough and well rounded review of literature relevant to the thesis topic and research questions.
Understand educational research methodologies and methods and use one  or a set of methodologies successfully to explore chosen research question(s).

Demonstrate the ability to collect and analyse data in a manner which is ethical, relevant and critical in responding to the topic and research question, and complies with legislative policies and processes (APST 7.1 & 7.2).
Demonstrate capacity to present a research project and findings in both oral and written form in a format appropriate to the task and the topic.

assessments.due_date:
24/10/2024 12:00 pm

Oral presentations will occur during the scheduled Thursday workshop time on 24 October 12 - 2pm. We will then enjoy afternoon tea together to celebrate your accomplishments! You will be able to invite family to this event - more details will be provided closer to the date.
assessments.task_description:
You are to present a compelling 3 minute oral presentation on your thesis and its significance in language appropriate to a non-specialist audience. Your presentation should briefly touch on each of the major components of your thesis as discussed in Assessment Task 1. Appropriate and relevant audio-visual aids may be used during your presentation. After your presentation, you will be expected to respond to questions from your peers and School of Education staff members. 

A discussion of implications of the research for teachers (that is, what do you think other teachers would want to know about your research?) should be included. 

Examples of the kind of presentation required are available here: http://threeminutethesis.org/ 

All Honours advisors and School of Education staff will be invited to attend. 

(APSTs: 6.1, 6.2, 7.1, 7.2)
assessments.submission_guidelines: Upload slides as one pdf file to TII by 5pm on 24 October 2024.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Your thesis should:

  • Clearly articulate the research problem, rationale, aims, objectives and research questions; 
  • Demonstrate understanding and application of contemporary relevant literature. Demonstrate your ability to critically review this literature and use it as the basis of an analytical framework for the thesis; 
  • Develop an appropriate research design to address your research questions and objectives. Describe and justify your use of appropriate research methods and techniques; 
  • Clearly present your analysis of data and discussion of findings; 
  • Discuss the conclusions of your research and implications of the research for teachers and/or the broader educational community; 
  • Demonstrate your ability to develop a coherent, central argument that is logical and well substantiated and sustained throughout; and 
  • Demonstrate clear and coherent written communication, including a well organised and logically structured thesis. There should be a clear and consistent chapter structure (with chapters and sections suitably titled) that is relevant to the main research question. 

(APST's: 6.1, 6.2, 7.1, 7.2)
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the TII link on Blackboard
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
